benchmark_details.name: IndoNLI: A Natural Language Inference Dataset for Indonesian
benchmark_details.overview: IndoNLI is the first human-elicited NLI dataset for Indonesian, consisting of 18,000 sentence pairs annotated by crowd workers and experts, designed to provide a challenging test-bed for Indonesian NLI.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To foster research in Indonesian NLP, especially for Natural Language Inference.

data.source: Indonesian Wikipedia, news, and web articles.
data.annotation: Annotated by crowd workers and experts.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correct predictions to the total predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of models on the NLI task.
methodology.validation: Use of a three-round annotation process for labeling with consensus.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential reinforcement of harmful stereotypes in the data.
